jwst.name: JWST
jwst.description: Most powerful infrared space telescope, studying early universe, galaxy formation, and exoplanet atmospheres

hubble.name: Hubble Space Telescope
hubble.description: Revolutionary space telescope providing deep field images and transforming our understanding of the universe

chandra.name: Chandra X-ray Observatory
chandra.description: Premier X-ray telescope studying black holes, supernovae, galaxy clusters, and high-energy phenomena

spitzer.name: Spitzer Space Telescope
spitzer.description: Infrared telescope that studied star formation, exoplanets, and distant galaxies

kepler.name: Kepler Space Telescope
kepler.description: Exoplanet hunter that discovered thousands of planets using transit photometry

tess.name: TESS
tess.description: All-sky exoplanet survey mission finding planets around nearby bright stars

gaia.name: Gaia
gaia.description: Creates 3D map of our galaxy, measuring positions, distances, and motions of over a billion stars

euclid.name: Euclid
euclid.description: ESA mission mapping dark matter and dark energy across cosmic history

roman.name: Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope
roman.description: Wide-field survey telescope for dark energy, exoplanets, and infrared astrophysics

alma.name: ALMA
alma.description: World's most powerful millimeter/submillimeter observatory studying star/planet formation and distant galaxies

vla.name: VLA
aliases: Karl G. Jansky Very Large Array
vla.description: 27-antenna radio telescope array studying radio emission from celestial objects

ska.name: SKA
ska.description: Next-generation radio telescope array with unprecedented sensitivity and survey speed

sdss.name: SDSS
sdss.description: Major spectroscopic survey creating detailed 3D maps of the universe

lsst.name: LSST
aliases: Legacy Survey of Space and Time
lsst.description: Wide-field survey telescope that will image the entire visible sky every few nights

jwstmiri.name: MIRI
jwstmiri.description: JWST's mid-infrared camera and spectrograph for studying cool objects and dust

jwstnirspec.name: NIRSpec
jwstnirspec.description: JWST's multi-object spectrograph for studying distant galaxies and exoplanet atmospheres

jwstnircam.name: NIRCam
jwstnircam.description: JWST's primary infrared imager and wavefront sensor

herschel.name: Herschel Space Observatory
herschel.description: Largest infrared telescope in space, studied star/galaxy formation and molecular clouds

planck.name: Planck
planck.description: Mapped cosmic microwave background with unprecedented precision, measuring universe's age and composition

wmap.name: WMAP
wmap.description: Measured temperature fluctuations in cosmic microwave background radiation

fermi.name: Fermi Gamma-ray Space Telescope
fermi.description: Studies the gamma-ray sky, including pulsars, blazars, and gamma-ray bursts

xmm.name: XMM-Newton
xmm.description: ESA's X-ray observatory studying black holes, neutron stars, and hot gas in galaxy clusters

nustar.name: NuSTAR
nustar.description: First focusing hard X-ray telescope in orbit, studying black holes and supernova remnants

swift.name: Swift
swift.description: Rapidly detects and studies gamma-ray bursts and other transient phenomena

integral.name: INTEGRAL
integral.description: ESA gamma-ray observatory studying violent cosmic phenomena and the galactic center

ixpe.name: IXPE
ixpe.description: First X-ray polarimetry mission studying magnetic fields in extreme environments

xrism.name: XRISM
xrism.description: JAXA/NASA X-ray observatory with high-resolution spectroscopy capabilities

athena.name: Athena
athena.description: Next-generation ESA X-ray observatory studying hot universe and energetic phenomena

nicer.name: NICER
nicer.description: Studies neutron stars and tests pulsar-based navigation for spacecraft

galex.name: GALEX
galex.description: UV survey telescope that mapped galaxy evolution across 10 billion years

fuse.name: FUSE
fuse.description: High-resolution UV spectroscopy studying interstellar medium and stellar atmospheres

iras.name: IRAS
iras.description: First space telescope to perform all-sky infrared survey, discovered infrared galaxies

wise.name: WISE
wise.description: All-sky infrared survey discovering asteroids, brown dwarfs, and distant galaxies

corot.name: CoRoT
corot.description: French-led exoplanet hunter and asteroseismology mission

cheops.name: CHEOPS
cheops.description: ESA mission characterizing known exoplanets with high-precision photometry

plato.name: PLATO
aliases: PLAnetary Transits and Oscillations of stars
plato.description: ESA mission finding and characterizing Earth-like exoplanets around Sun-like stars

ariel.name: Ariel
ariel.description: ESA mission studying atmospheres of hundreds of exoplanets

hipparcos.name: Hipparcos
hipparcos.description: First space astrometry mission, created precise star catalog with parallaxes

soho.name: SOHO
soho.description: Continuously monitors the Sun, discovering thousands of comets

sdo.name: SDO
sdo.description: Studies solar variability and its impacts on Earth with high spatial/temporal resolution

stereo.name: STEREO
stereo.description: Twin spacecraft providing 3D views of solar corona and coronal mass ejections

parkersolar.name: Parker Solar Probe
parkersolar.description: First spacecraft to fly into Sun's corona, studying solar wind and magnetic fields

solarorbiter.name: Solar Orbiter
solarorbiter.description: ESA/NASA mission studying Sun's poles and solar wind from close distances

keck.name: Keck Observatory
keck.description: Twin 10-meter telescopes with adaptive optics and powerful spectroscopic capabilities

vlt.name: VLT
vlt.description: ESO's flagship facility with four 8.2-meter telescopes that can work together

gemini.name: Gemini Observatory
gemini.description: Twin 8.1-meter telescopes providing full-sky coverage with adaptive optics

subaru.name: Subaru Telescope
subaru.description: Japanese 8.2-meter telescope with wide-field imaging capabilities

magellan.name: Magellan Telescopes
magellan.description: Twin 6.5-meter telescopes operated by US consortium

lbt.name: LBT
lbt.description: Two 8.4-meter mirrors on single mount with advanced adaptive optics

gbt.name: GBT
gbt.description: World's largest fully steerable radio telescope at 100 meters

arecibo.name: Arecibo Observatory
arecibo.description: Former 305-meter radio telescope, famous for SETI and planetary radar observations

fast.name: FAST
fast.description: World's largest single-dish radio telescope at 500 meters, studying pulsars and SETI

lofar.name: LOFAR
lofar.description: Large-scale low-frequency radio telescope network studying cosmic rays and exoplanets

meerkat.name: MeerKAT
meerkat.description: 64-dish precursor to SKA, studying HI, pulsars, and transients

noema.name: NOEMA
noema.description: Most powerful millimeter interferometer in Northern Hemisphere

carma.name: CARMA
aliases: Combined Array for Research in Millimeter-wave Astronomy

elt.name: ELT
elt.description: ESO's 39-meter telescope, will be world's largest optical/near-IR telescope

tmt.name: TMT
tmt.description: Planned 30-meter telescope with adaptive optics for deep space observation

gmt.name: GMT
gmt.description: Seven 8.4-meter mirrors combining for 24.5-meter effective aperture

cfht.name: CFHT
cfht.description: 3.6-meter telescope known for wide-field imaging surveys

lamost.name: LAMOST
aliases: Large Sky Area Multi-Object Fiber Spectroscopic Telescope
lamost.description: 4-meter telescope with 4000-fiber spectrograph for massive spectroscopic surveys

panstarrs.name: Pan-STARRS
aliases: Panoramic Survey Telescope and Rapid Response System
panstarrs.description: Wide-field survey telescopes discovering asteroids, supernovae, and variable stars

ztf.name: ZTF
ztf.description: High-cadence all-sky survey finding supernovae, asteroids, and transient events

palomar.name: Palomar Observatory
palomar.description: Historic 5.1-meter telescope that dominated astronomy for decades

mmt.name: MMT Observatory
mmt.description: 6.5-meter telescope operated by University of Arizona and Smithsonian

salt.name: SALT
salt.description: Largest single optical telescope in Southern Hemisphere at 11 meters

het.name: HET
het.description: 9.2-meter telescope optimized for spectroscopy and dark energy studies

jwstfgs.name: FGS/NIRISS
aliases: Near Infrared Imager and Slitless Spectrograph
jwstfgs.description: JWST's pointing control sensor and Canadian science instrument for exoplanet studies

ixo.name: Lynx
ixo.description: Proposed NASA flagship X-ray mission with unprecedented sensitivity

habex.name: HabEx
habex.description: Proposed 4-meter space telescope with starshade for direct exoplanet imaging

luvoir.name: LUVOIR
luvoir.description: Proposed 8-15 meter flagship mission for exoplanet characterization and astrophysics

sofia.name: SOFIA
sofia.description: Airborne 2.7-meter infrared telescope flying above atmospheric water vapor

eso36.name: ESO 3.6m
eso36.description: Home of HARPS spectrograph, major exoplanet discovery facility

tng.name: TNG
tng.description: Italian 3.6-meter telescope with HARPS-N for exoplanet studies

ngts.name: NGTS
ngts.description: Array of 12 small telescopes hunting for transiting exoplanets

speculoos.name: SPECULOOS
aliases: Search for habitable Planets EClipsing ULtra-cOOl Stars
speculoos.description: Network of robotic telescopes searching for exoplanets around ultracool dwarfs

hat.name: HATNet
hat.description: Network of small automated telescopes discovering transiting exoplanets

wasp.name: SuperWASP
wasp.description: Two robotic observatories discovering transiting exoplanets

vista.name: VISTA
aliases: Visible and Infrared Survey Telescope for Astronomy
vista.description: ESO's 4.1-meter infrared survey telescope with wide field of view

vst.name: VST
vst.description: 2.6-meter telescope designed for wide-field optical surveys

ukirt.name: UKIRT
ukirt.description: 3.8-meter dedicated infrared telescope performing wide-field surveys

irtf.name: IRTF
irtf.description: 3-meter NASA facility optimized for infrared planetary and solar system studies

ligo.name: LIGO
ligo.description: First detector to observe gravitational waves, detecting mergers of black holes and neutron stars

virgo.name: Virgo
virgo.description: European gravitational wave detector working in conjunction with LIGO

kagra.name: KAGRA
kagra.description: Cryogenic underground gravitational wave detector, part of global GW network

geo600.name: GEO600
geo600.description: German-British gravitational wave detector serving as technology testbed

lisa.name: LISA
lisa.description: Space-based GW detector with 2.5 million km arms, detecting supermassive black hole mergers

einsteintelescope.name: Einstein Telescope
einsteintelescope.description: Proposed third-generation underground GW observatory with 10x sensitivity of Advanced LIGO

cosmicexplorer.name: Cosmic Explorer
cosmicexplorer.description: Proposed next-generation GW detector with 40 km arms, 10x more sensitive than LIGO

icecube.name: IceCube
icecube.location: South Pole, Antarctica (1.5-2.5 km deep ice)
icecube.description: Cubic-kilometer neutrino detector using Antarctic ice, discovered astrophysical neutrinos

antares.name: ANTARES
aliases: Astronomy with a Neutrino Telescope and Abyss environmental RESearch
antares.location: Mediterranean Sea off France (2.5 km deep)
antares.description: Underwater neutrino telescope in Mediterranean Sea monitoring Northern Hemisphere

kmnet.name: KM3NeT
kmnet.description: Next-generation underwater neutrino observatory with detectors off Italy, France, and Greece

superkamiokande.name: Super-Kamiokande
superkamiokande.description: 50,000-ton water Cherenkov detector studying solar, atmospheric, and supernova neutrinos

hyperkamiokande.name: Hyper-Kamiokande
hyperkamiokande.description: Next-generation 260,000-ton water detector, successor to Super-Kamiokande

dune.name: DUNE
dune.location: Sanford Lab, South Dakota (1.5 km underground)
dune.description: Massive liquid argon detector studying neutrino oscillations with beam from Fermilab

nova.name: NOvA
nova.description: Long-baseline neutrino experiment studying oscillations with Fermilab beam

borexino.name: Borexino
borexino.description: Ultra-pure liquid scintillator detector, made precision measurements of solar neutrinos

sno.name: SNO
sno.description: Heavy water detector that confirmed neutrino oscillations, Nobel Prize 2015

snoplus.name: SNO+
snoplus.description: Successor to SNO using liquid scintillator, studying solar neutrinos and neutrinoless double-beta decay

t2k.name: T2K
t2k.location: Tokai to Kamioka, Japan (295 km baseline)
t2k.description: Long-baseline neutrino oscillation experiment using Super-Kamiokande as far detector

miniboone.name: MiniBooNE
miniboone.description: Oil Cherenkov detector that investigated neutrino oscillations and anomalies

microboone.name: MicroBooNE
microboone.description: Liquid argon time projection chamber studying neutrino interactions and anomalies

baikal.name: Baikal-GVD
baikal.description: Underwater neutrino telescope in world's deepest lake detecting high-energy cosmic neutrinos

xenon1t.name: XENON1T
xenon1t.description: Liquid xenon detector searching for WIMP dark matter with ultra-low background

xenonnt.name: XENONnT
xenonnt.description: Upgraded 8.3-ton liquid xenon detector, most sensitive WIMP dark matter experiment

lux.name: LUX
lux.location: Sanford Lab, South Dakota (1.5 km underground)
lux.description: 370 kg liquid xenon detector that set world-leading WIMP exclusion limits

luxzeplin.name: LUX-ZEPLIN
luxzeplin.location: Sanford Lab, South Dakota (1.5 km underground)
luxzeplin.description: 10-ton liquid xenon detector combining LUX and ZEPLIN technologies for WIMP searches

pandax.name: PandaX
pandax.location: China Jinping Underground Laboratory (2.4 km underground)
pandax.description: Series of liquid xenon detectors in world's deepest underground lab searching for dark matter

cdms.name: CDMS
cdms.description: Pioneering cryogenic germanium/silicon detector searching for WIMP dark matter

supercdms.name: SuperCDMS
supercdms.description: Advanced cryogenic detector sensitive to low-mass dark matter particles

darkside.name: DarkSide
darkside.description: Liquid argon detector using underground argon from Colorado to reduce backgrounds

darkside20k.name: DarkSide-20k
darkside20k.description: Next-generation 20-ton liquid argon detector for WIMP dark matter searches

deap.name: DEAP-3600
aliases: Dark matter Experiment using Argon Pulse-shape discrimination
deap.description: Single-phase liquid argon detector with 3.6 tons searching for WIMP dark matter

cresst.name: CRESST
aliases: Cryogenic Rare Event Search with Superconducting Thermometers
cresst.description: Cryogenic detector using calcium tungstate crystals, sensitive to low-mass dark matter

edelweiss.name: EDELWEISS
aliases: Expérience pour DEtecter Les Wimps En Site Souterrain
edelweiss.location: Modane Underground Laboratory, France (1.7 km underground)
edelweiss.description: Cryogenic germanium bolometers searching for WIMP-nucleus interactions

admx.name: ADMX
admx.description: Haloscope using microwave cavity to search for axion dark matter particles

dama.name: DAMA/LIBRA
aliases: DArk MAtter/Large sodium Iodide Bulk for RAre processes
dama.description: Sodium iodide scintillator detecting annual modulation signal claimed as dark matter

coupp.name: COUPP
aliases: Chicagoland Observatory for Underground Particle Physics
coupp.description: Bubble chamber technology using superheated liquids for WIMP detection

pico.name: PICO
pico.description: Bubble chamber using superheated C3F8, sensitive to spin-dependent WIMP interactions

darwin.name: DARWIN
aliases: DARk matter WImp search with liquid xenoN
darwin.description: Proposed 50-ton liquid xenon detector, ultimate WIMP dark matter sensitivity

cosine.name: COSINE-100
cosine.description: Sodium iodide detector testing DAMA/LIBRA annual modulation claim

anais.name: ANAIS
anais.description: Sodium iodide detector independently testing DAMA annual modulation signal
